MemberSignature.Value: public static string ToCmykaString (this Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.Color color, System.Globalization.CultureInfo? cultureInfo = default);
.method public static hidebysig string ToCmykaString(class Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.Color color, class System.Globalization.CultureInfo cultureInfo) cil managed
<Extension()> Public Function ToCmykaString (color As Color, Optional cultureInfo As CultureInfo = Nothing) As String
static member ToCmykaString : Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.Color * System.Globalization.CultureInfo -> string

Docs.summary: Converts this to a containing the cyan, magenta, yellow, key and alpha components.
Docs.returns: A in the format: CMYKA(cyan,magenta,yellow,key,alpha) where cyan, magenta, yellow and key will be a value between 0% and 100% and alpha will be a value between 0 and 1. (e.g. CMYKA(100%,100%,0%,100%,1) for ).

static member ToCmykString : Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.Color -> string

Docs.summary: Converts this to a containing the cyan, magenta, yellow and key components.
Docs.returns: A in the format: CMYK(cyan,magenta,yellow,key) where cyan, magenta, yellow and key will be a value between 0% and 100%. (e.g. CMYK(0%,100%,100%,0%) for ).

static member ToHslaString : Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.Color * System.Globalization.CultureInfo -> string

Docs.summary: Converts this to a containing the hue, saturation, lightness and alpha components.
Docs.returns: A in the format: HSLA(hue,saturation,lightness,alpha) where hue will be a value between 0 and 360, saturation and lightness will be a value between 0% and 100%, and alpha will be a value between 0 and 1. (e.g. HSLA(0,100%,50%,1) for ).

<Extension()> Public Function ToHslString (color As Color) As String
static member ToHslString : Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.Color -> string

Docs.summary: Converts this to a containing the hue, saturation and lightness components.
Docs.returns: A in the format: HSL(hue,saturation,lightness) where hue will be a value between 0 and 360, and saturation and lightness will be a value between 0% and 100%. (e.g. HSL(0,100%,50%) for ).
